alert.note: Alert for Coke; Crockett; Fisher; Haskell; Irion; Jones; Nolan; Runnels; Sterling; Taylor; Throckmorton; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 11 at 3:30AM CDT until April 12 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A Red Flag Warning has been issued for much of the Big Country, Concho Valley, and Crockett country for late Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening.... .A combination of a very dry air mass, gusty winds, and ongoing drought conditions will lead to dangerous fire conditiions Tuesday afternoon and evening. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 9 PM CDT TUESDAY FOR FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 049, 054, 064, 065, 066, 071, 072, 076, 098, 099, 113, AND 127... The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a Red Flag Warning for much of the Big Country, Concho Valley and Crockett County, which is in effect from 11 AM to 9 PM CDT Tuesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. *WINDS...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph from late morning Tuesday through Tuesday evening. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 8 percent. * FUELS...extremely dry to critically dry. * IMPACTS...Conditions will be favorable such that if fires develop, they could spread quickly. Burning is therefore discouraged.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will occur shortly. A combination of strong winds, low humidity and dry fuels will contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Coke; Crockett; Fisher; Haskell; Irion; Jones; Nolan; Runnels; Sterling; Taylor; Throckmorton; Tom Green
